intro: Asteriscium polycephalum, commonly known as the clustered starflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
